title: my saved passwords are gone
content:
i opened firefox (v.95) and tried opening up my email and found that all my saved passwords were gone from firefox on my computer. it said i should crate a firefox account to get my logins back so i did and i still could not access any of my web logins. so i searched the help pages. opened up my profile n made a backup of my key3, key4, n loginjson files, downloaded v.91 firefox esr and copied my key3 file into a new profile.

so i still dont have my web logins ... n now i have an outdated version of firefox with none of my bookmarks either. im sick of troubleshooting n my wifi is almost out for the month.

how do i get my web logins and bookmarks back so i dont have to spend hundreds of hours recreating them?
creator: redfoxole

title: Updating Firefox to Version 95.0 from Version 94.0.2
content:
Hi. have updated Firefox from version 94.0.2 to version 95.0. [windows 10]. i now have no history, no bookmarks or saved links. there is nothing from the previous firefox version in the current version. it's like i'm just starting out with firefox?.


Thanks

title: Firefox for linux: what's the difference between ~/.cache/mozilla/firefox/ and ~/.mozilla/firefox/.../storage/default/{url}/cache/
content:
I am trying to figure out what does not need to be included in my `rsync` backups. I noticed two apparent types of cache directories:

Many files following this format, as as example. ``` ~/.mozilla/firefox/...default-release/storage/default/https+++[URL]/cache/morgue/217/{2f9...d9}.final ``` and ``` ~/.cache/mozilla/firefox/...default-release/ ``` The latter contains sub-directories and a file `activity-stream.discovery_stream.json`.

Why are there these two different formats for caches? Which one or both can I exclude from backups?
creator: steve.z

title: Firefox on PC usually mutilates title of internet news articles that I am trying to print or save (MS print to PDF)
creator: tobin.michael

title: Prblems after update
content:
I use a web based program called Print Shop Pro at work and have always used Firefox as my browser. The updates are automatic and have never been a problem before. This morning after the update, the file generator in Print Shop Pro is now coming up landscape instead of portrait like it has always done, and there is no way we can change it.

We print shipping and job tickets together double sided, they have always come out portrait before. Now they come out landscape this makes them 4 pages instead of 2 and the 2 extra pages are either blank or have just a little bit on them.

How can we get them to generate in portrait layout again?
creator: velinda.hunter

title: Unable to load Trend Micro Toollbar
content: Until recently I was prompted to load the Trend Micro Toolbar when I opened Firefox but then got an error message. I no longer get that prompt and cannot find the Trend Micro Toolbar when I search for the extension. I used to use Mozilla all the time but without the extension I am reluctant to use it now for banking or other secure transactions. There was some information on your site that you were working on the issue some time ago but it does not seem to have been resolved yet. Your assistance appreciated Thanks Ana
creator: anamonks
